abstract.p: H M Feinberg letter seconds Anthony Lewis's positive comments on race relations in South Africa (May 27 column)

block.p: Anthony Lewis's May 27 column about South Africa was refreshingly positive. When I was living there last year, I could see that there had been a remarkable transformation, not just among elite groups but also in the banks, supermarkets and stores.

Anthony Lewis's May 27 column about South Africa was refreshingly positive. When I was living there last year, I could see that there had been a remarkable transformation, not just among elite groups but also in the banks, supermarkets and stores.
White and black co-workers care for one another. An Afrikaner acquaintance attended an integrated party wearing an African dress borrowed from her black colleague, something unheard of a decade ago.
The government's success is seen in hundreds of thousands of new or refurbished houses. Miles of roads have been paved. Water and electricity are available to more people.
I recall the statement of a South African exile: ''We must help this government to succeed or we will have fought for nothing.'' That is commitment.
H. M. FEINBERG New Haven, May 29, 2000
